button-name: Here's an example of a button with `aria-label` attribute: ```html ``` In this example, we have a button that is used to close a dialog. The button contains a "Ã—" character as its content, which might not be very informative for screen reader users. By adding the `aria-label` attribute with the value "Close dialog", we provide a more descriptive label for screen reader users, so they can understand the purpose of the button. Here's an example of a button with `aria-labelledby` attribute: ```html ``` In this example, we have a button that is used to submit a form. The button contains a text "Submit form" as its content. By adding the `aria-labelledby` attribute with the value "submitBtnText", we associate the button with the text inside the `` element with the ID "submitBtnText". This way, screen reader users will hear the "Submit form" label when the button is focused, providing a clear understanding of the button's purpose.
